title: Sports briefs: C's win exhibition
text: Sports briefs: C's win exhibition fosters.com Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:05 PM Updated at 11:05 PM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:05 PM BOSTON — Jared Sullinger scored 16 points and grabbed eight rebounds to help lead the Celtics to a 99-85 exhibition victory over the Knicks on Thursday night. Sullinger was 6 of 10 and had six assists in 19 minutes. Tyler Zeller finished with 15 points, Jae Crowder added 13 and David Lee had seven points and eight boards. For the Knicks, Carmelo Anthony scored eight points on 4-of-18 shooting in 31 minutes. Jose Calderon tallied 17 points and eight rebounds and Derrick Williams added 14 points. Anthony struggled, missing six of his first seven shots. He was held scoreless for over 20 minutes until a pair of baskets late in the first half. Boston's Marcus Smart dished out nine assists, tying his personal best. The Celtics wraps up their exhibition schedule against Philadelphia on Friday. — The Associated Press College soccer UNH women fall at Hartford WEST HARTFORD, Conn. — The University of New Hampshire women's soccer team fell 2-0 at Hartford on Thursday. UNH finished the regular season at 6-9-3 overall and 4-4 in conference play. The Wildcats clinched a tournament playoff spot by virtue of Binghamton's 1-0 win over Maryland-Baltimore County. Hartford is 10-2-4, 4-0-3. Mimi Borkan made two saves in net for UNH. — Staff reports NFL Pats make cuts FOXBOROUGH, Mass. — The New England Patriots have released defensive lineman Khyri Thornton from the 53-man roster and offensive lineman Brennan Williams from the practice squad. Thornton was a third-round draft pick by the Packers. The Patriots claimed him off waivers from Green Bay last month. He had already been released once and signed to the practice squad. Williams was a third-round draft choice by the Houston Texans in 2013. He was released by Houston and went to training camp with Jacksonville this summer. His father, Brent Williams, played defensive end with the Patriots from 1986-93. College Corran retires at UVM BURLINGTON, Vt. — The athletic director at the University of Vermont is retiring at the end of June. Robert Corran, who is also an associate vice president at UVM, announced Thursday he would retire from the position he has held since 2003. Corran said he has been considering retirement for the past year. He says he's proud of his accomplishments during his time at UVM. Among the milestones during Corran's time at UVM are three appearances by the men's hockey team in the NCAA men's hockey tournament, a trip to the Frozen Four in 2009 and seven consecutive America East Academic Cups. He has also overseen improvements in UVM's athletic facilities. UVM says it will conduct a nationwide search for Corran's replacement. — The Associated Press
